1193907982507094017.text: He still keeps in touch with two fellow Vietnam Veterans and assists others dealing with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder. Thank you Mr. Short for your service and willingness to share your history as a veteran with us to archive. Your service to our country is unforgettable🇺🇸 4/4

1193907981668229121.text: During the Vietnam War, Mr. Short survived what he described as a suicide human wave attacks from the Vietcong and was able to fend off their attacks. He remarked that "I felt God had listened to my prayers and called them off." (3/4)

1193907980883939328.text: He later served in Vietnam as a Corporal from August 1966 to September 1967 as a Marine Corp Machine Gunner. His campaign awards include the Republic of Vietnam, Vietnam Service Medal, National Defense Medal, Rifle Marksman, and Purple Heart with two stars. (2/4)

1193907976530206720.text: We interviewed Vietnam War Veteran, Elmer Dewey Short, Jr., of Phoenix, to archive his military service for the @librarycongress.
